text:
raevia.
• Non-placental - vaginal and cervical lesions including cancer, cervical infections, trauma; and uterine rupture
• Unknown - APH of unknown origin.
NB: do not ignore bleeding if postcoital, it still can signify pathology. 
Emergency management 
At a clinic or community health centre 
• Start an intravenous infusion of one litre Sodium Chloride 0,9%.
• If the mother is in shock, resuscitate with one to two litres of Sodium Chloride 0,9%.
